alert.note: Alert for Beartooth Foothills; Livingston Area (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Wind Warning issued December 31 at 2:08PM MST until January 03 at 6:00PM MST by NWS Billings
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM SATURDAY TO 6 PM MST MONDAY... * WHAT...Southwest winds gusting up to 75 mph expected. Local blizzard conditions in blowing snow. Dangerous wind chills. * WHERE...Livingston Area and Beartooth Foothills. * WHEN...From 6 AM Saturday to 6 PM MST Monday. Strongest wind gusts expected Saturday night through mid day Sunday. * IMPACTS...Dangerous crosswinds will make travel difficult to impossible at times for high profile vehicles and those towing trailers. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...As winds become strong, blowing snow will create widespread poor visibility and significant drifting snow. Localized blizzard conditions are possible, which along with significant drifting snow may make travel impossible, including portions of I-90. Dangerous wind chill values of -30 to -50 degrees are forecast, lowest Saturday. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... People should be prepared for very difficult to impossible travel and dangerous winter conditions from Saturday through Monday. Don`t travel during this time if you don`t have to. Travelers should have winter survival kits with them and notify someone of your travel plans and arrival time. Getting stranded in this high wind winter situation could be life threatening. Additional graphics for this hazard can be found at http://www.weather.gov/billings
